abstract: Autosaves the document’s contents to an appropriate file-system location, as needed.

declaration.code: @MainActor func autosave(withImplicitCancellability autosavingIsImplicitlyCancellable: Bool, completionHandler: @escaping ((any Error)?) -> Void)

overview:
## Discussion

The default implementation of this method does the following:

If the value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], calls [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/autosavesInPlace] on the class to determine where the autosaved document contents should go.

The method also gets the value in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/fileURL] to ensure that the file has an actual URL, because it is not possible to autosave in place if the document does not yet have a permanent location. 3. Checks the value in the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/autosavingFileType] property to determine the file type for the autosaved file. 4. Calls [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/save(to:ofType:for:completionHandler:)].

The value of the `saveToURL` parameter is the location where the file should be saved. If the file has a URL and the class specifies that autosave should occur in place, this is the URL of the file. Otherwise, this is the location of a nonexistent file in the specified autosave location.

The value for the `ofType` parameter is determined by a call to [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/autosavingFileType].

The value of the `forSaveOperation` parameter is `NSAutosaveInPlaceOperation` if the class is configured to autosave in place and the file has a URL. Otherwise, the value is `NSAutosaveElsewhereOperation`.

# autosave(withImplicitCancellability:completionHandler:)

**Instance Method**

Autosaves the document’s contents to an appropriate file-system location, as needed.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func autosave(withImplicitCancellability autosavingIsImplicitlyCancellable: Bool, completionHandler: @escaping ((any Error)?) -> Void)
```

```swift
@MainActor func autosave(withImplicitCancellability autosavingIsImplicitlyCancellable: Bool) async throws
```

## Parameters

- **autosavingIsImplicitlyCancellable**: The value in the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/autosavingIsImplicitlyCancellable] property while autosaving is happening.
- **completionHandler**: The completion handler block object passed in to be invoked at some point in the future, perhaps after the method invocation has returned. The completion handler must be invoked on the main thread.

The block takes one argument:



## Discussion

The default implementation of this method does the following:

1. Checks the value of the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/hasUnautosavedChanges] property.
2. If the value of that property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], the method runs the completion handler with a `nil` error and returns immediately.

If the value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], calls [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/autosavesInPlace] on the class to determine where the autosaved document contents should go.

The method also gets the value in [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/fileURL] to ensure that the file has an actual URL, because it is not possible to autosave in place if the document does not yet have a permanent location. 3. Checks the value in the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/autosavingFileType] property to determine the file type for the autosaved file. 4. Calls [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/save(to:ofType:for:completionHandler:)].

The value of the `saveToURL` parameter is the location where the file should be saved. If the file has a URL and the class specifies that autosave should occur in place, this is the URL of the file. Otherwise, this is the location of a nonexistent file in the specified autosave location.

The value for the `ofType` parameter is determined by a call to [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSDocument/autosavingFileType].

The value of the `forSaveOperation` parameter is `NSAutosaveInPlaceOperation` if the class is configured to autosave in place and the file has a URL. Otherwise, the value is `NSAutosaveElsewhereOperation`.

## Autosaving the Document

- **checkAutosavingSafety()**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether it is safe to autosave document changes.
- **hasUnautosavedChanges**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the document has changes that have not been autosaved.
- **scheduleAutosaving()**: Schedules periodic autosaving for the purpose of crash protection.
- **autosave(withDelegate:didAutosave:contextInfo:)**: Autosaves the document’s contents to an appropriate location in the file system.
- **backupFileURL**: The URL for the document’s backup file that was created during an autosave operation.
